{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3549564,"name":"Fatuma ","username":"Fatumat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fatumat/{size}/240770_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T18:32:38.408Z","cooked":"

I am having a problem with our motor controllers not responding. I updated a few motor controllers to the Robo-Rio, which resulted in this issue. The sensor fault status lights began to blink, and a glitch in my Rev Hardware Client occurred, forcing me to close the application. The blinking would not stop, so I eventually unplugged the battery. However, since then, motor controllers have not responded, and I would like to know if I have to replace them.

They also wont show up on the Rev Hardware Client

Try the recovery mode. We had lots of issues updating Spark Max’s this year but all of them were able to be upgraded using the recovery mode.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T18:47:52.076Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":15.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494512,"topic_slug":"motor-controllers-not-responding","display_username":"Hayden Mumm","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68713,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6318 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/motor-controllers-not-responding/494512/3","custom_user_title":"6318 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3549600,"name":"Mike","username":"Mike_FRC_56","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_frc_56/{size}/178961_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T18:56:05.770Z","cooked":"

To enter recovery mode:

  • Turn off robot
  • Open Rev hardware client but don’t plug anything in
  • Use a small tool to press and hold the “mode” button on the SparkMax. Keep this button pressed
  • Plug the SparkMax (while keeping button pressed) into the laptop

Rev hardware client should now detect the device. You can click on it and load the right firmware

When you connected multiple new SparkMax’s into your CAN bus, did you assign them unique CAN IDs first? You can get weird results if you have multiple devices all with the same CAN ID (default is zero), so set those CAN IDs and update firmware with Rev Hardware client over USB-C before turning on the robot with all of these on the CAN bus
